reviews.text: We were very happy to be going on a break to Amsterdam again after not going for 3 years and were very sadly disapointed when we got to this hotel we had booked over the internet. The photos of the rooms on the web site look great but trust me the room we were show to had no resemblence to the advert. The first room we were offered was very small and the bathroom was like a cupboard with broken tiles and black grouting, it had twin beds and my husband and I had booked a double, the nets at the windows were brown from smoking and it stunk. We went back to reception and asked for an upgrade and were taken to another room which did have a double bed but the curtains were also brown and the bathroom small and smelly again with broken tiles. There was no wardrobe in the room only an old broken chest of draws with a small TV on the top and a wooden chair to sit on so we had no where to put our suitcase or clothes. We again asked for another room but were told they were full and had no choice but to stay there. We decided to make the best of it and had a rest then went out for a meal and a walk we returned later and had a quick shower which to be fair was ok then went to bed. I got up around 3am to visit the toilet and opened the bathroom, put on the light and there was a huge cockroach sitting on the toilet seat and another one running across the floor to the pipes at the back of the loo. We got dressed and went downstairs to see the night manager who although did not speak English very well was very nice. He sent another guy who was working in the kitchens up stairs to get rid of them and he took of all things a can of Glade airfreshner with him, what for I will never know. He went into our bathroom, laughed and knocked the roach onto the floor and squished it, the other one had scarpered. We packed the few things we had taken out of the case and went down to reception to ask for a refund the guy who had diposed of the roach had returned to the kitchen with roach juice on his hands and shoes and carried on with out washing his hands (YUCK) We were told by the night manager he could not give us a refund and would have to wait for the day receptioist to arrive. We sat in the reception from 4am till she arrived at 8am and were told that we were dirty people and that we had bought the cockroaches in on out shoes, well forgive me but if I had a two inch bug on my shoe I think I would have noticed it. We left and went to the tourist board who booked us into the Crown Plaza American which was only £5 a night more than the roach motel. They told us the Delta was only suitable for back packers and young people and that they should not have 3* in their opinion they should be graded at 1+. All in all our 4 night much needed trip away form work, kids and housework turned into a bit of a nightmare and would definitely NOT NOT NOT be staying in this flee pit again.
reviews.title: disgusting filthy rip off
Grotty
reviews.text: Dirty, hot room. Took 3 days before they put a fan in the room. Windows opened inwards and you walked into them if you had to go to the toilet during the night. Carpet on the wall? Very strange. Grubby bathroom. Breakfast unusual, okay if you like eating off chipped plates and cups. Certainly not worthy of its 3 stars. Only good thing going for it is location. Have stayed in better 2 stars in Amsterdam. Only book this if its cheap and you're not fussy.

reviews.title: Don't laugh - this is our FAVORITE hotel!
reviews.text: Jeez, I can't believe all these bad reviews are about my FAVORITE hotel in the world: The Delta Hotel (or as my wife calls it: the Delta House!). We have travelled happily to Amsterdam 7 times and have stayed at the Delta 5 of those times and wished we had the other 2 times. YES the lobby is small (who cares?) but the staff has ALWAYS been more than gracious (ie: making us food & drinks AFTER the restaurant has closed, watched our luggage and chatted cheerfully with us). Grant it, we ALWAYS stay in our favorite room(s) - in particular room 330 or ANY room with the small balcony. These balcony rooms face the Dam (AND we were warned that it can get noisy) but for two people they're HUGE with tall ceilings and, as I mentioned, two french doors that open to a balcony overlooking the Dam. We were able to enjoy the Christmas parade right outside our room (Black Peter even threw candy up to us!). Yeah, breakfast was basic but never cold and I have NEVER seen any mice or critters in our room and the showers/bathrooms seemed no different from any other hotel.

This hotel has TONS of personality, sits next door to a killer french fry stand and is a 4 minute walk from central station. By the way, the hotel picture on the websites that shows the sign & the balconies: THAT'S ME STANDING ON THE BALCONY LOOKING OUT! Go to the Delta, just ask for a balcony room facing the street.
reviews.title: Decent but not great
Dirty dive but close to station
reviews.text: Good location in the centre of amsterdam, near train station. Staff were friendly and helpful. The problem was cleanliness, particularly in the bathroom. They also added an extra tax of around 40 euros which we weren't aware of.
Stayed 15-17 January 2005 wobbly WC, cold and inedible breakfast, Shower was either red hot or ice cold in seconds. Not worth the money
reviews.title: GHASTLY
Friendly staff
reviews.text: Things seem to have improved at the hotel since the some of the other reviewers have stayed there. My biggest compliment is that after I left my wallet in the room they posted it back to me in England complete with money and all the cards.

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location and is relatively cheap. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast, especially the scrambled egg, was very mediocre, however. All in all, a decent place that isn't as bad as you've heard.

reviews.title: An absolute disgrace!!
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights April/05. Room was tiny with the bed against one wall and 20 cms from the other.Light switch by the door-so to turn off have to walk in dark round corner, up step and climb into bottom of bed. No bedside light. on arrival 2 of the 3 lightbulbs in room were broken. In spite of having booked a "total" price with agency were ripped off to tune of 21.60 euros on leaving.
Noisy at night,in scuffy area-chip shop next door. Room and hotel down at heel and dirty.
reviews.title: not for the faint hearted
Great location and good as a base
reviews.text: I strongly suggest you stay elsewhere.

After reading other reviews about this hotel, we considered cancelling and booking something else! But it was the location we were after which is fab for town and red light district. Went with two friends and had a triple room 4th floor. Room was neat and tidy nothing to write home about but for £75 a night in Amsterdam you cant really complain. No window in Bathroom did make it a bit smelly at times but you could open the bedroom window. Fan in room, nice little touch and the last nights guests stuff in the bedside table! Safe not screwed down in wardrobe so a bit pointless as you could take the whole thing! All in all fine if your main use of the place is to sleep, as for the noisy chippy it was always shut when we rolled home at 5am! Goes without saying, never saw breakfast!
reviews.title: Cheap n Cheerfull!
Avoid at all costs
reviews.text: Stayed here for a Stag Do. Rooms were OK, although one of our foursomes ended up with the attic room which wasn't fit for storage let alone accommodation. Admittedly, when another room became available they were moved.

reviews.title: This place stinks! (Literally!)
reviews.text: All was going OK until checkout, when they tried to sting us for phone calls we hadn't made and premium channels we hadn't watched. Needless to say, we refused to pay and they eventually waived the fees.

reviews.title: Great for lads, but I wouldn't take the wife
reviews.text: Then, a month after checkout, a mysterious £150 charge appeared on my bank statement. They'd taken it upon themselves to debit my account for a tv we allegedly threw on the floor. Absolute rubbish. Currently trying to get this money back from them.

In my opinion, although the accommodation was OK, and the location was good, I would never recommend to anyone I know staying here, as it might end up costing you a ----sight more than you bargained for !!
